title: Birds Of A Feather
opening: After speaking with the village magistrate, Eliwood and company set their sights on Laus. The road from Pherae to Laus passes through Santaruz. Eliwood suspects his missing father must have visited Santaruz en route to Ostia. Eliwood arranges a meeting with the local ruling lord to see what he can learn.

Hector leaves Ostia. He moves towards Santaruz to meet up with Eliwood as quickly as possible. He encounters a mysterious group whose dark garb hide an even darker secret. Perhaps these same powers have turned their blades on Eliwood...Hector hurries south, praying for his friend's safety.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: What? Eliwood is here?

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Yes. He has set camp up on a hill south of here. He seeks permission to enter Santaruz. He seeks an audience with you.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Could it be... Do you think Eliwood’s come to ask of his father? If that’s the case... I... I know not what to tell him.

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Tell him you know nothing, and let him be on his way.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Yet... I know young Eliwood well. His father, Elbert, and I are old friends. I’ve no children of my own, and I’ve always treasured Eliwood... I do not believe I could look him in the eye and... I could not lie to him. I could not.

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: We’ve no choice then. Let us chase the boy away. If you do not speak with him, you need tell no lies.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Wait! Do you mean to harm Eliwood?

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Not harm. Frighten. A scratch or two will leave no scars. He will run home to Pherae and be done with his adventure. He is, after all, all that Pherae has left...

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Instead of entering Laus with such a small group, we should meet with Marquess Santaruz and request his assistance... I see the sense in that. It’s a good plan, Mark.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Truly so. I tell you again, I’m pleased to have you with us. Lord Helman... He’s not only my father’s friend. I’ve known him since I was a child. I’m sure that he will help us.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: What? Lord Eliwood! Beware!

intro.speaker: Zagan
intro.line: Heh heh heh... Noble sirs. Alms for a poor villager.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Poor villager? You look nothing like an honest man. Clear the road. Step quickly or...

intro.speaker: Zagan
intro.line: Step quickly? Heh heh... Good advice. Maybe it’s you who should follow it!

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Zagan
intro.line: Someone wants the boy in an early grave. A shame if you ask me, but he’ll die here today. C’mon, boys! Earn your keep!

intro.speaker: Dorcas
intro.line: Here we go again, eh, Mark? Just like old times... Seems our fates are bound. Natalie? Oh, she’s still in Pherae. I’m working for you this time, so she’s not too worried. Guide my axe, Mark.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Lord Hector! I have it! I know where Lord Eliwood is. He entered Santaruz not far from here.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Is that so? We've read his movements fairly well, then. Let's move due south and cross the border. We'll meet up with him in Santaruz!

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Ah! There you are! Lord Hector!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Oh, no...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Serra? W-What... What are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: You're going to meet Lord Eliwood, right? Well, I want to go, too!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Go home! This is no game.

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: But Oswin told me it was all right to come!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oswin?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Yes, my lord. On the marquess's orders. Serra and I will be accompanying you.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bah. This is ridiculous. Always have to have the last word, eh, Brother?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: No matter what you think, he's just worried about you, Lord Hector. You're the only family he has.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I know...

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Lord Hector! Up ahead! There appears to be fighting.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Where? Is it Eliwood? Come! Let's get closer! Hurry! Oswin! Matthew!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Yes, my lord!

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Oh! Wait for me! I'm coming, too!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hey! What's going on over there? Looks like some rough business. You! Soldier! Are you just going to stand there and watch?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Who do you think you are? This is Santaruz. What occurs here is no affair of any foreign lordling!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I believe I'm going to have to disagree with you. You see, the man they're attacking happens to be a friend of mine.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: A friend? What? ...Urrrgh!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Sorry, but I'm in a hurry.

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Ewww! That's terrible! I loathe violence!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Nicely done, my lord! You're a fighter born.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: I cannot condone resorting to force so quickly...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Chastise me later, Oswin. First, we deal with these brigands! Come! We must help Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Help Eliwood? Sounds like a convenient excuse for more violence.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oswin!

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Yes, yes. I'm coming!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Matthew! Bring Serra and follow along.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: What! With...Serra?

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: No! I want to go with you now!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Absolutely not! You'll slow us down! zzz

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Oh! How rude!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oswin! Let's go!

battle.speaker: Zagan
battle.line: Bah! He puts up a good fight for a pampered noble pup. It’s up to me to finish him.

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: How many are there? This looks–

battle.speaker: Hector
battle.line: Hey! What’s going on over there? Looks like some rough business. You! Soldier! Are you just going to stand there and watch?

battle.speaker: Oswin
battle.line: Yes, yes. I’m coming!

battle.speaker: Hector
battle.line: Matthew! Take Serra and find someplace to hide.

battle.speaker: Matthew
battle.line: What! With...Serra?

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: No! I’m going with you!

battle.speaker: Hector
battle.line: You are not! You’ll slow us down!

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: Oh! How rude!

battle.speaker: Hector
battle.line: Oswin! Let’s go!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Hmm... You look like you’ve some experience with battle. No need to conceal it. I’ve fought in many a battle in my time, I assure you. Let me tell you one thing about combat, though. The most important thing is technique. If you’ve no skill, you’ll rarely strike your enemy. My instructor gave me this secret book long ago. It will improve the fighting prowess of the one who reads it. I’m too old to make use of it, so why don’t you take it?

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: It’s really important to trust your companions, yes? If you have a boon companion fighting at your side, you feel stronger and more confident. Hm? Who do I think make good companions for whom? Well, I am a fortune-teller, so I could do a reading, but...

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: I saw them, I did. About a month ago...Marquess Pherae and his men passed right through here. They’ve all gone missing, haven’t they? A group as strong as that just up and vanishing...Couldn’t have been bandits, but...I don’t believe it. Must’ve been something terrible. The world’s become a dangerous place, it has.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: The marquess who leads Santaruz is Lord Helman. He doesn’t ask for much, and he’s a nice enough fellow. I wouldn’t call him weak, but he is more follower than leader. Lately, he’s been meeting with Marquess Laus quite a lot. I hope nothing bad comes of it, but...

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: Later! First let’s take care of these louts.

boss.speaker: Zagan
boss.line: Curses! What are you waiting for!? Let me show you boys how it’s done!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Whew...Is that all of them?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector! Where did you come from?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Well met, Eliwood.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes, but...what are you doing here?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: You wound me!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: How do you mean?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: You’re looking for your father, right? Why didn’t you send word?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Your brother was just named Marquess Ostia. He’s going to be very busy setting up his court council. Lord Uther must need your support. You are his brother, after all.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: My brother is not so weak. Oh, he has mentioned some things in public, but...He knew exactly what I was planning, and he let me go.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Is that so? Well then, it would be unwise to refuse his kindness! It does me good to see you, Hector. Thank you.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Think nothing of it. You know Oswin, don’t you?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Well met, Lord Eliwood.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: It is good to see you again, Oswin. So you came as well?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Yes. Lord Uther was worried about Lord Hector traveling alone. I’ve been ordered to keep a close eye on him.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ha ha ha! Of course! Good to have you with us.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Lord Hector! Why didn’t you tell me the fighting was done!?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: I apologize for the interruption. I couldn’t restrain her any longer!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Are these your companions, Hector?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oh...Yes, I suppose they are. One might have hoped for better, but...

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: That was uncalled for! I can’t believe you said that! Matthew, did you hear what he said about you?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Me? He was talking about you!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector, why don’t you introduce us?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: The noisy one is Serra. Believe it or not, she’s a cleric.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Yes, I am Serra, my lord. Pleased to meet you.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: And that’s Matthew. He does a lot of...sneaking around.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: My lord.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Sneaking...around.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Well...I, er...gather information, open doors, chests, and such. I’ve got...nimble fingers.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: That sounds...like a thief’s work...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Well...Don’t let it worry you.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: This journey...I suspect it will be harder than you imagine. You may have to accept things like this if you want to survive.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: What is it, Hector? Do you know something?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Nothing specific. Rumors abound, though. A league of assassins from Bern has been moving around in Lycia. Experienced bounty hunters and mercenaries are vanishing...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: That reminds me. One of the men who attacked us said something odd.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What was it?

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Lord Eliwood, if I may?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Marcus! Good to see you!

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Lord Hector, it’s been far too long. Your assistance is greatly appreciated.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Come now, Marcus. No need for such formalities. Tell me what you heard.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Of course. The apparent leader of that gang of thugs...He indicated that someone was watching Lord Eliwood...That someone needed him dead.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Hmm...That is troubling. Actually, a captain of the guard was watching the fight when we arrived. He was a knight of Santaruz, and yet he just stood there and let a lord be attacked. I think he was planning on seeing you die.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: So, Mark. What do you think? ...You might be right. Something may have happened to Lord Helman, too. Come! We must hurry to the castle!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Eliwood! Who is this?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: This is Mark. I required tactical aid in the search for my father, and...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oh, I see. So this is who directed the battle plan back there, hm? You know, Mark, you’re very young. We’ve many strategists in Ostia, but none so young. Eliwood, are you sure about this one?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mark is still a student of military strategy, but...We’ve received nothing but sound advice so far. Mark has my trust.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: All right. I suppose I shall witness your skills firsthand. Well met, Mark.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Hello! How have you been, Mark? Eh? My secret’s revealed? Oh, that. Yes, it’s true. My guise as a common thief was but a ruse. I’ve served House Ostia for some time as a spy of sorts! Surprised? Well, regardless, it looks like we’ll be traveling together again. Here’s to our mutual survival!

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Eeeeeeee! Mark! Is it really you? It’s been far, far too long! You missed me, didn’t you? Of course you did. I knew it. Hm? Didn’t I tell you before? I’m in the employ of Ostia, Lycia’s ruling territory. I’ll be here to help you just like before! Aren’t you lucky!
